name: Twitterbot
tagline: A bot for Twitter written in Java.
body:
#TwitterBot
By Grayson Spidle

I am in no way copyrighting this program or anything in it. I do not intend to profit off anything this program does or charge for the duplication of my code. However, if your Twitter account/program violates the rules of Twitter I won't be held responsible.

Read the [Twitter rules for automated applications](https://support.twitter.com/articles/76915)

##CREDITS
ANYTHING IN THE `cleverbot` PACKAGE I DID NOT MAKE. I LEFT THE ORIGINAL COMMENTS IN THE PROGRAM TO MAKE THIS OBVIOUS.
I AM USING THE SOFTWARE UNDER THE GNU LESSER GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE WHICH CAN BE FOUND IN `License.txt`

##LIBRARIES USED
* twitter4j-core-4.0.4.jar
* appengine-api-1.0-sdk-1.3.7.jar
* clever-bot-api

**NONE OF THE LIBRARIES LISTED ABOVE ARE OWNED BY ME AND CREDIT OF THEIR CREATION GOES TO THEIR RIGHTFUL OWNERS.**

##DESCRIPTION
This program connects to a Twitter application, (I removed the access keys and consumer keys, you will need to provide your own) and makes the account connected to the application automatically reply it it's followers and following. Any user can unsubscribe to the bot by directly messaging the account: "unsubscribe"

Read my wiki on the GitHub page for a little more explicit explanation on the program's capabilities.

##USAGE
I would greatly appreciate it if you say that you based your program off of mine, but it isn't legally required.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
